channel.title: Question About Motors
channel.description:
Hi there - Sorry in advance for the probable noobiness of this question. I'm not too experienced with electronics and the like. :o
So I want to do something for school with a motor...I want it to rotate 1/8 of a turn, pause, rotate 1/8 a turn, pause, etc.
Is there a special type of motor I need for this? Or is there something else I'd need to do?
Thank you

Why do you want to do this? There may be an easier way.

Also you don’t have to do it with electronics, you could do it with gears and/or springs. It’s basically how a watch works.

item.title: Question About Motors
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

Try giving it a bash with a stepper motor! Look up on them, you will need to build a controller for the steps. As for pausing etc you could use a PIC. Again read up, shouldn’t be too hard. :S

EDIT: I’ve come up with a simple and easy stepper motor driver thats built from logic gates! Still thinking of pausing but you could just hold the clock input for a set time.
